alert.note: Alert for Barton; Dade; Jasper; Lawrence; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 22 at 2:25AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barton, Dade, Jasper, Lawrence and Newton. * WHEN...Until 830 AM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 225 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional heavy rain will be possible. - This includes the following low water crossings... Center Creek at Dogwood Road, Center Creek at County Road 2220, Center Creek at Azalea Drive, Dry Fork at Pine Road, Fidelity Branch at County Road 130, Muddy Creek at Highway 126 and Spring River at County Road 2110. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northern Joplin, Carthage, Monett, Aurora, Mount Vernon, Lamar, Webb City, Oronogo, Carterville, Sarcoxie, Pierce City, Jasper, Golden City, Miller, Verona, Alba, Purcell, Airport Drive, Nashville, Carytown, Fidelity, Stotts City, Neck City, Lamar Heights, Freistatt, Wentworth, Avilla, La Russell, Brooklyn Heights, Reeds, Hoberg, Maple Grove, Dudenville, Red Oak, Meinert, Kenoma, Boston, Atlas and Oakton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
